events.originalText: The last members of a junior association football team and their coach were rescued from Tham Luang Nang Non, a flooded cave in northern Thailand.
events.subtitle: Association football
events.headline: Thai football team rescued from flooded cave in Tham Luang Nang Non

events.originalText: The Russian river cruise liner Bulgaria was caught in a storm in Tatarstan on the Volga River and sank in several minutes, resulting in 122 deaths.
events.subtitle: Bulgaria (ship)
events.headline: Russian river cruise liner sinks in storm on Volga River, 122 dead

events.originalText: The last edition of the British tabloid News of the World was published, closing due to allegations that it hacked the voicemails of murdered schoolgirl Milly Dowler, victims of the 7/7 attacks and relatives of deceased British soldiers.
events.subtitle: Tabloid journalism
events.headline: News of the World closes amid hacking scandal involving Milly Dowler

events.originalText: Typhoon Ewiniar made landfall over Korea, potentially causing thousands of deaths in North Korea.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Ewiniar (2006)
events.headline: Typhoon Ewiniar hits Korea, thousands feared dead in North Korea

events.originalText: The United States defeated China in the final match of the FIFA Women's World Cup, setting records in both attendance and television ratings for women's sports.
events.subtitle: United States women's national soccer team
events.headline: US beats China in FIFA Women's World Cup final, sets records

events.originalText: John Paul Getty III, a grandson of the American oil magnate J. Paul Getty, was kidnapped in Rome.
events.subtitle: John Paul Getty III
events.headline: John Paul Getty III kidnapped in Rome

events.originalText: Martin Luther King Jr. led a rally in support of the Chicago Freedom Movement, one of the most ambitious civil rights campaigns in the northern United States.
events.subtitle: Martin Luther King Jr.
events.headline: Martin Luther King Jr. leads rally for Chicago Freedom Movement

events.originalText: An American naval aviator discovered a downed Mitsubishi A6M Zero (pictured) on Akutan Island, Alaska, which was later rebuilt and flown to devise tactics against that type of aircraft.
events.subtitle: Akutan Zero
events.headline: American naval aviator discovers downed Mitsubishi A6M Zero in Alaska

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Ethnic Poles murdered at least 340 Jewish residents of Jedwabne in German-occupied Poland.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Holocaust: Ethnic Poles murder 340 Jewish residents in Jedwabne

events.originalText: Second World War: The Battle of Britain, in which the Royal Air Force defended the UK from attacks by the German Luftwaffe, began.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Battle of Britain begins as RAF defends UK from Luftwaffe attacks

events.originalText: Indian mystic and spiritual master Meher Baba began his silence until his death in 1969, only communicating by means of an alphabet board or by unique hand gestures.
events.subtitle: Guru
events.headline: Indian mystic Meher Baba begins silence until death in 1969

events.originalText: Irish War of Independence: One day after a truce was agreed between the Irish Republican Army and British forces, violence broke out between Catholics and Protestants in Belfast.
events.subtitle: Irish War of Independence
events.headline: Violence erupts in Belfast after truce between IRA and British forces

events.originalText: The air temperature in Furnace Creek, California, reached 134 °F (56.7 °C), recognized by the World Meteorological Organization as the highest recorded on Earth.
events.subtitle: Furnace Creek, California
events.headline: Furnace Creek, California records highest temperature on Earth

events.originalText: Indian sepoys mutinied against the East India Company at Vellore Fort.
events.subtitle: Sepoy
events.headline: Indian sepoys mutiny against East India Company at Vellore Fort

events.originalText: Lord Wellesley, Governor-General of India, founded Fort William College in Calcutta.
events.subtitle: Richard Wellesley, 1st Marquess Wellesley
events.headline: Lord Wellesley founds Fort William College in Calcutta

events.originalText: English Civil War: The Parliamentarians destroyed the last Royalist field army at the Battle of Langport, ultimately giving Parliament control of the west of England.
events.subtitle: English Civil War
events.headline: Parliamentarians defeat Royalists at Battle of Langport

events.originalText: Lady Jane Grey (pictured) was proclaimed the successor to King Edward VI of England, beginning her disputed reign as the "Nine Days' Queen".
events.subtitle: Lady Jane Grey
events.headline: Lady Jane Grey proclaimed successor to King Edward VI

events.originalText: The Treaty of Tagilde was signed between Ferdinand I of Portugal and representatives of John of Gaunt of England, marking the beginning of the Anglo-Portuguese Alliance, which remains in effect today.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Tagilde
events.headline: Treaty of Tagilde signed, marking start of Anglo-Portuguese Alliance
